items.name: Great Mosque of Djenné
items.description: A UNESCO World Heritage site and the largest mud-brick building in the world, showcasing Sudano-Sahelian architecture.

items.name: Timbuktu Manuscripts Library
items.description: A historical collection of ancient Islamic and African scholarly works preserved for centuries.

items.name: Sankoré University
items.description: One of the world’s oldest universities, renowned for Islamic scholarship in the 15th century.

items.name: Sidi Yahya Mosque
items.description: Built in the 15th century, this mosque reflects the city's spiritual and cultural heritage.

items.name: Ahmed Baba Institute
items.description: A modern archive preserving thousands of manuscripts from Mali’s golden age.

items.name: Timbuktu Museum
items.description: Home to exhibitions of local artifacts, manuscripts, and historical relics from the Mali Empire.

items.name: Bou Djoudé Market
items.description: A lively open-air market offering traditional goods, crafts, and regional spices.

items.name: Sahara Desert Camp
items.description: Experience nomadic life with camel rides and overnight desert stays near Timbuktu.
